item.title: Michelle add a quote by The Bible for Today
item.description: "Therefore, do not worry about tomorrow, for tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own." -- The Bible for Today

item.title: Michelle add a quote by The Apostle Paul
item.description: "I have fought the good fight, I have finished the course, I have kept the faith" -- The Apostle Paul

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up." -- Anonymous

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Love is patient; love is kind and envies no one. Love is never boastful, nor conceited, nor rude; never selfish, not quick to take offense. Love keeps no score of wrongs; does not gloat over other men's sins, but delights in the truth. There is nothing love cannot face; there is no limit to its faith, its hope, and endurance. [....] In a word, there are three things that last forever: faith, hope, and love; but the greatest of them all is love." -- Anonymous

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Corrie Ten Boom
item.description: "Memories are the key not to the past, but to the future." -- Corrie Ten Boom

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "God doesn't require us to succeed, he only requires that you try." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "I'm a little pencil in the hand of a writing God, who is sending a love letter to the world." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mohandas Gandhi
item.description: "God, as Truth, has been for me a treasure beyond price. May He be so to every one of us." -- Mohandas Gandhi

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Where love is, there God is also." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Bodhidharma
item.description: "According to the Sutras, evil deeds result in hardships and good deeds result in blessings." -- Bodhidharma
